abstract: Gary Lehman, who was to sing the title role of Wagner's "Siegfried" at the Metropolitan Opera, has pulled out because of illness.
snippet: Gary Lehman, who was to sing the title role of Wagner's "Siegfried" at the Metropolitan Opera, has pulled out because of illness.
lead_paragraph: Gary Lehman, who was to sing the title role of Wagner's "Siegfried" at the Metropolitan Opera, has pulled out because of illness, the Met said on Wednesday. Jay Hunter Morris, who made his Met debut in 2007 and had the Siegfried role in the San Francisco Opera's recent "Ring" production, will take his place. The Met's "Siegfried" opens on Oct. 27, with the Nov. 5 matinee to be broadcast to movie theaters in high definition.
